In order to streamline the process, no changes will be considered outside of the Sept. 17-Sept. 23 request window.

We thank you for your cooperation.

Bay City Junior High art students Dallas C and Jasmine G placed in the Third Annual Matagorda Bay Birdfest’s Youth Art Contest earlier this year in March.

Dallas, an eighth grade student, won second place and $100, while Jasmine, a sixth grade student, took third and a $50 prize. Additionally, Dallas and Jasmine’s work will be reproduced on 5" x 7" postcards, which will be for sale to the public for $12 for a set of nine.

Sixth grade students Ashley M and Aracely P received Honorable Mentions.

In this year’s contest, the featured bird was the Roseate Spoonbill. The students were challenged to learn about and depict these birds in their local Texas habitat.

Over 291 contestants from all school districts in Matagorda County competed in three different categories. BCJH students competed in the largest category, the grades four through eight group.

BCJH art teachers are Renee Lawrence and Leslie Stevens.

Photos of BCJH winners:

Ashley M

Dallas C

Here's a glimpse of what some of you have going on at home:

Brock attends Tenie Holmes and Clair attends Linnie Roberts.

2) First grader Phoenix enjoyed her Zoom meeting with Mrs. DeLong and Mrs. Godley. She attends Linnie Roberts.

3) Camden, a Cherry Pre-K student, practices writing and coloring a rainbow in Mrs. Davis' class.

#BCISDatHome

Bay City ISD will extend the suspension of normal district operations until further notice, in an effort to support the nation’s need to flatten the curve of the COVID-19 pandemic and slow the spread of the virus. We will re-evaluate every 3-4 weeks & provide updates following those assessments.

Way to go AVID students and teachers!

The Bay City Junior High swim team competed at the Southeast Texas Middle School Championship in Rosenberg on January 23rd, with the team finishing eighth out of 14 teams. The meet featured over 200 seventh and eighth grade swimmers from all over the Houston area.

Top finishers for Bay City included:
Lucie F – 1st in 50 yard Freestyle; 2nd in 50 yard Butterfly
Megan M – 2nd in 50 yard Breaststroke; 4th in 200 yard Freestyle
Suhona K – 4th in 50 yard Backstroke

The mixed Medley Relay of Suhona K (backstroke) Megan M (breaststroke), Lucie F (butterfly) and Chris C (freestyle) finished in sixth place.

Head Coach Bob Button said, “We ended our junior high season on a high note with some excellent swims! I was especially proud of the way our eighth grade ‘veterans’ took care of the seventh grade ‘rookies.’ Most of our rookies hadn’t ever been to a meet of this magnitude and they handled the pressure very well.
This was a fun group of kids to work with this year. The improvement since November was tremendous and I hope they all stick with the sport.”

Way to go Panthers!!!

Our Bridges students have started off 2020 the right way!
The students have utilized Chromebooks to complete several advanced skills - setting up a personal email account and learning email basics (sending emails, etiquette and safety); setting up online accounts for job search websites such as WorkInTexas and Indeed (including importing their resumes); using job searches to find positions that they are qualified for and interested in.

Several of our students have already applied to 6+ jobs currently available in our community! The students have worked VERY hard and overcome the frustration of using technology. It is difficult to find employment that doesn't require and online job application -- roughly 90% of job applications are online format now! Please when you see our Bridges students, congratulate them on this huge accomplishment. (photos and info submitted by Megan Clegg)

Bay City Independent School District, along with Communities in Schools (CIS) of Brazoria County, has been awarded a Texas Education Agency grant to expand Communities in Schools to Bay City ISD.

Communities in Schools works directly in schools to build relationships that empower students to stay in school and succeed in life. CIS school-based staff partner with teachers to identify challenges students face in class or at home and coordinate with community partners to bring outside resources inside schools.

CIS in Texas is administered by the Texas Education Agency (TEA). CIS staff work year-round, full-time, and on school campuses. BCISD is partnering with CIS of Brazoria County, which currently serves 6,500 students over 90 program sites in nine school districts.

The BRIDGES students completed their annual holiday shopping earlier this month. The students began the project by setting a budget for themselves and then began to plan their gift lists. The students used the internet to find the exact items they wanted to buy, along with locating the stores, sizes and costs.
The lesson also included planning for lunch and what they wanted for snacks.
The students gained a better understanding of what it means to "stay on budget" and learned to shop in a real-world setting.
According to BRIDGES teacher Megan Clegg, "Everyone did great! We were able to stay on a budget, find gifts for those we love and work toward independence. They wrapped the gifts themselves, put them under our tree, and are ready to give out their gifts."
To learn more about the BRIDGES program: https://www.bcblackcats.net/Page/130
(photos courtesy Megan Clegg)

Therefore, BCISD PD and Cherry took precautionary measures and immediately put the campus on "LOCK IN" status. All entrances and exits were secured and monitored and no visitors were admitted into Cherry during that time. Classroom instruction continued as normal during this time, however, students stayed in the secure classrooms and were not allowed outside. The "LOCK IN" status was lifted by BCPD and BCISD PD at 8:40 a.m.

From BCHS Head Swim & Dive Coach Bob Button:
"Tuesday, 11/12, our high school swimmers traveled to Rosenberg for a tri-meet with Lamar Consolidated and Terry.
Our boys beat both Lamar & Terry, while our girls fell to both. We split in combined scoring, besting Terry 76-68, but falling to Lamar 84-73.
I was very pleased with our kids' efforts. We did see some important areas we'll need to improve on, mainly our turns and overall conditioning.
Our next meet will be Thursday, the 21st. We're hosting Hightower, Columbia, & Brazosport."
Congrats to the Blackcat Swimmers & Divers! #PROWL
